metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1318 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
The crash reporting feature in Apport 2.13 through 2.17.x before 2.17.1allows local users to gain privileges via a crafted usr/share/apport/apportfile in a namespace (container).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
apport-gtk - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
apport-kde - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
apport-noui - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
apport-retrace - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
apport-valgrind - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
dh-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
python-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
python-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
python3-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
python3-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.1-0ubuntu3.9').
